abstract: Federal agents raid 37 locations in southern California that they say are illegal 'birth factories' where Chinese women come to give birth so that their babies will gain United States citizenship; raid, largest carried out so far, is intended to crack down on birth tourism industry, not mothers themselves, since it is not illegal for foreigners to give birth in America.
lead_paragraph: The raids were part of a federal inquiry into an industry that helps pregnant Chinese women travel to the United States to deliver babies who will have American citizenship.

headline.main: California Apartments Raided in Federal Investigation of Chinese ‘Birth Tourism’
headline.print_headline: California Apartments Raided in Federal Investigation of Chinese ‘Birth Tourism’

snippet: The raids were part of a federal inquiry into an industry that helps pregnant Chinese women travel to the United States to deliver babies who will have American citizenship.
